pullRequest.title: [DOCS] Adds limitation item about inference trained model backward compatibility
pullRequest.bodyText:
Overview
This PR adds a new limitation item to the DFA limitations list about the backward compatibility of the inference trained models created in 7.8.0.
Dependency note
Merge this PR only after elastic/elasticsearch#55260 merged.

commit.message: [DOCS] Adds limitation item about inference trained model backwards compatibility.

nodes.bodyText:
I think this should use the same order as in the paragraph:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            === {infer-cap} trained models created in 7.8 are not compatible backwards
          
          
            
            === {infer-cap} trained models created in 7.8 are not backwards compatible
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -161,3 +161,11 @@ Example:
   }
 }
 ```
+
+[float]
+[[dfa-inference-bwc]]
+=== {infer-cap} trained models created in 7.8 are not compatible backwards

nodes.bodyText:
I wonder if stored is the right verb here. Should it something like this?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            least 7.8.0 to use a model stored by a 7.8.0 node.
          
          
            
            least 7.8.0 to use a model created on a 7.8.0 node.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -161,3 +161,11 @@ Example:
   }
 }
 ```
+
+[float]
+[[dfa-inference-bwc]]
+=== {infer-cap} trained models created in 7.8 are not compatible backwards
+
+Inference models created in version 7.8.0 are not backwards compatible with 
+older node versions. In a mixed cluster environment, all nodes must be at 
+least 7.8.0 to use a model stored by a 7.8.0 node.

commit.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Co-Authored-By: Lisa Cawley <lcawley@elastic.co>
